text.p: Lithuanian newspapers carried the following reports in their Friday editions. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:

- The situation in the eastern Lithuanian town of Pabrade calmed down after authorities agreed to negotiate with six hundred illiegal migrants housed in a refugee camp following the riot on Wednesday.
- An explosion in a Volvo 850 car injured two people in Vilnius on Thursday.
- The Bank of Lithuania lent 4.3 million litas to Tauras Bank to help its liquidity. Tauras hopes to improve its activity with a 40 million litas share issue.
- Anyksciu Wine posted 1.7 million litas net profit and 15 million litas in sales during the first four months of the year.
- The board of Lithuania's Savings Bank wants to boost its share capital by 30 million litas to 90 million litas but the state, which holds a 74.25 percent stake, has not taken any decision yet.
- The Lithuanian government decided that Lithuania's citisens working abroad will not have to pay double taxes.
- There were 3.705 million inhabitants in Lithuania at the end of April, the statistics department said.
- Lithuania's Property Bank has recovered seven million litas of bad loans in the first quarter of 1997.
